item.title: 卡夫亨氏选择史蒂夫-卡希莱恩为新任首席执行官
item.description: 卡夫亨氏周二任命业内资深人士史蒂夫-卡希莱恩（Steve Cahillane）为新任首席执行官，任期自 2026 年 1 月 1 日起。【原文：Kraft Heinz on Tuesday named industry veteran Steve Cahillane as its new CEO, effective January 1, 2026.】

item.title: 辉瑞公司预测 2026 年利润低于预期，原因是 COVID 产品销售额下降
item.description: 辉瑞公司周二预测 2026 年的利润将低于华尔街的预期，因为该公司预计其 COVID 产品的销售额将下降，这使其股价在盘前交易中下跌了 1.6%。【原文：Pfizer on Tuesday forecast 2026 profit below Wall Street estimates as it expects lower sales of its COVID products, sending its shares down 1.6% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 早间新闻就业消息、人工智能忧虑和石油下跌
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 投资者为关键就业报告做准备，华尔街期货下滑
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货下滑，因为在一份备受瞩目的就业报告公布之前，市场开始变得谨慎，这份报告可能会让人洞察到经济的健康状况和明年利率的潜在走向。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Tuesday as caution set in ahead of a highly anticipated jobs report that could offer insight into the health of the economy and the potential path for interest rates next year.】

item.title: 特朗普限制代理顾问的新命令可能削弱股东权利
item.description: 公司治理分析师和律师表示，白宫旨在控制代理咨询公司的一项新命令标志着共和党在削弱投资者作用、将更多权力交到首席执行官手中的更广泛努力中迈出了重要一步。【原文：A new White House order aiming to rein in proxy advisory firms marks a major step in a broader Republican effort to weaken the role of investors and put more power in the hands of CEOs, corporate governance analysts and attorneys said.】

item.title: 聚焦：华尔街银行不情愿地准备全天候股票交易
item.description: 全天候交易正快速向美国股市逼近，但并非所有华尔街的人都欢迎这一举措。【原文：Round-the-clock trading is fast approaching U.S. stock markets, but not all of Wall Street is embracing the move.】

item.title: 美国大银行透支费因监管和经济形势变化而猛增
item.description: 据路透社分析，今年前九个月，美国最大的零售银行中有 14 家从透支和支票退票费中获得的收入大幅增长，而两家大银行的收入则大幅下降。【原文：Fourteen of the largest U.S. retail banks posted jumps in the income they generated from overdraft and bounced-check fees during the first nine months of the year, while two big banks reported sharp declines, according to a Reuters analysis.】

item.title: 商界领袖们都认为人工智能是未来的趋势。他们只是希望它现在就能发挥作用。
item.description: 去年春天，葡萄酒收藏应用 CellarTracker 建立了一个人工智能侍酒师，根据用户的口味为其提供不加修饰的葡萄酒推荐。问题是这个聊天机器人太友好了。【原文：Last spring, CellarTracker, a wine-collection app, built an AI-powered sommelier to make unvarnished wine recommendations based on a person’s palate. The problem was the chatbot was too nice.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车销量的领先者和落后者
item.description: 由于欧盟希望推动汽车制造商生产电动汽车，因此整个欧洲大陆的电动汽车销量并不均衡，更多的是向北部和西部国家倾斜，而南部和东部国家则往往落在后面。【原文：As the European Union has looked to push carmakers towards electric vehicles, sales of EVs across the continent have been uneven, skewed more to northern and western countries, while nations further south and east have tended to lag.】

item.title: Counterpoint 称芯片成本上升将导致 2026 年全球智能手机出货量下降
item.description: 以技术为重点的市场研究公司 Counterpoint 周二表示，由于芯片成本上升可能影响需求，预计明年全球智能手机出货量将下降 2.1%。【原文：Global smartphone shipments are expected to decline 2.1% next year as rising chip costs are likely to impact demand, technology-focused market research firm Counterpoint said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 报告显示，2025 年全球保险灾难损失将达到 1,070 亿美元
item.description: 瑞士再保险研究所周二的一项研究显示，受洛杉矶野火和美国部分地区强对流风暴的影响，2025年全球自然灾害的年保险损失预计将达到1070亿美元。【原文：Annual global insured losses from natural catastrophes are expected to hit $107 billion in 2025, driven by the Los Angeles wildfires and severe convective storms in parts of the United States, a Swiss Re Institute study showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国结束对约56.8万辆现代汽车安全带问题的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周二表示，美国已经结束了对今年早些时候现代汽车公司的568,580辆帕利塞德SUV因安全带意外松开而进行的初步调查。【原文：The United States has closed a preliminary probe into 568,580 Hyundai Motor's Palisade SUVs opened earlier this year over inadvertent unlatching of seat belts, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 金融稳定委员会称，"影子银行 "的增长速度是传统贷款机构的两倍
item.description: 金融稳定委员会（Financial Stability Board）周二表示，去年非银行金融部门在全球资产中所占的份额增至 51%，即 256.8 万亿美元，其扩张速度是传统银行业的两倍。【原文：The non-bank financial sector's share of global assets grew to 51%, or $256.8 trillion, last year and expanded at double the rate of the traditional banking industry, the Financial Stability Board said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称福特召回近 32,000 辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周二表示，福特汽车公司将在美国召回32160辆汽车，因为失去驱动力会增加车祸风险。【原文：Ford Motor is recalling 32,160 vehicles in the United States, as loss of drive power increases the risk of a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司赢得谷歌马来西亚数据中心 21 年供电协议
item.description: 法国道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）周二表示，它已与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司签署了一项为期 21 年的电力供应协议，承诺提供 1 太瓦时的可再生能源，以支持其在马来西亚的数据中心。【原文：France's TotalEnergies said on Tuesday it had signed a 21-year power supply deal with Alphabet's Google , pledging to supply 1 terawatt hour of renewable energy to support its data centres in Malaysia.】

item.title: 应用程序开发商敦促欧盟对苹果公司的收费行为采取行动
item.description: 由 20 家应用程序开发商和消费者团体组成的联盟周二呼吁欧洲监管机构对苹果公司执行欧盟法律，称在美国法院最近作出裁决后，苹果公司的收费结构不公平地使欧洲开发商与美国竞争对手相比处于不利地位。【原文：A coalition of 20 app developers and consumer groups on Tuesday called upon European regulators to enforce EU laws against Apple , saying the company's fee structure unfairly disadvantages European developers compared to their U.S. rivals after a recent court decision in the United States.】

item.title: 奢侈品公司 Kering 与 Ardian 敲定纽约房地产交易
item.description: 古驰（Gucci）的所有者开云集团（Kering）和私募股权投资公司 Ardian 周二表示，他们已就一项价值 9 亿美元的纽约房地产交易达成了合资协议。【原文：Gucci owner Kering and private equity firm Ardian said on Tuesday that they had completed a joint venture agreement for a New York property deal valued at $900 million.】

item.title: 福特退出电动汽车市场后，LG 能源解决方案公司股价下跌 6
item.description: 韩国电池制造商 LG Energy Solution 的股价在格林尼治标准时间 0554 点前下跌了 6%，因为其客户福特汽车公司周一表示，该公司将取消几款电动汽车车型。【原文：Shares of South Korean battery maker LG Energy Solution fell 6% by 0554 GMT after customer Ford Motor said on Monday it is killing several electric vehicle models.】

item.title: 早间竞价：数据大爆炸前市场情绪低落
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 晨星 DBRS 表示，2026 年私人信贷压力将进一步加剧违约现象
item.description: 信用评级机构 Morningstar DBRS 周二表示，全球私人信贷借款人利润率的减弱将可能导致 2026 年进一步的贷款违约，该机构同时重申了对这一快速增长行业的负面展望。【原文：Weakening profit margins at private credit borrowers globally will likely lead to further loan defaults in 2026, credit rating agency Morningstar DBRS said on Tuesday, as it reaffirmed its negative outlook for the fast-growing sector.】

item.title: 延迟发布的美国就业报告预计将显示劳动力市场疲软
item.description: 经济学家预测，由于联邦政府削减成本，10 月份非农就业人数预计会下降，11 月份美国就业增长可能会反弹，这仍与劳动力市场逐渐疲软的趋势一致。【原文：U.S. job growth likely rebounded in November following an anticipated decline in nonfarm payrolls in October because of federal government cost-cutting, economists predicted, still consistent with a gradually weakening labor market.】

item.title: MBK 和 YoungPoong 寻求法院禁令，阻止韩国锌业的股份出售计划
item.description: 韩国私募股权公司MBK Partners和金属冶炼厂YoungPoong Corp周二在一份声明中称，已向当地法院申请禁令，阻止韩国锌业公司出售股份以资助在美国建设冶炼厂的计划。【原文：South Korean private equity firm MBK Partners and metal smelter YoungPoong Corp have filed for an injunction at a local court to block Korea Zinc's share sale plan to fund the construction of a smelter in the U.S., MBK said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国人工智能芯片公司比邻将于未来几周在香港上市
item.description: 四位知情人士透露，中国人工智能芯片初创企业比仁科技（Biren Technology）的目标是在未来几周内在香港首次公开募股。【原文：Chinese AI chip startup Biren Technology aims to launch a Hong Kong initial public offering in the coming weeks, four sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 福特 195 亿美元电动汽车减记：五件事须知
item.description: 福特汽车公司周一宣布对电动汽车的投资将达到 195 亿美元，这是迄今为止汽车行业从汽车制造商在本世纪初全心全意拥抱的技术中后退的最明显迹象。【原文：Ford Motor announced a $19.5 billion charge on electric-vehicle investments on Monday, the most visible sign to date of the auto industry’s pullback from a technology carmakers wholeheartedly embraced early this decade.】

item.title: 韩国媒体委员会提名人寻求限制青少年使用社交媒体
item.description: 韩国最高广播和媒体监管机构负责人提名人周二告诉国会，他将继续对青少年使用社交媒体施加限制，并称这是保护青少年的优先事项。【原文：The nominee to head South Korea's top broadcast and media regulator told parliament on Tuesday he would pursue imposing restrictions on social media use for teenagers, saying it was a priority as a means to protect young people.】

item.title: 投资者在数据和央行会议前焦虑不安，股市下滑
item.description: 周二，在包括就业报告在内的一系列美国数据公布之前，投资者采取了谨慎的态度，这些数据可能有助于判断美联储明年的政策轨迹。【原文：Asian stocks tumbled while the dollar drifted near two-month lows on Tuesday as investors adopted a cautious approach ahead of a slate of U.S. data, including the jobs report, that may help gauge the trajectory for Federal Reserve policy next year.】

item.title: 乌克兰谈判和疲软的中国数据导致油价走低
item.description: 周二早盘，油价下跌，扩大了上一交易日的跌幅，原因是俄罗斯与乌克兰达成和平协议的前景似乎有所加强，从而提高了人们对制裁可能放松的预期。【原文：Oil prices fell in early trading on Tuesday, adding to the previous session's losses, as prospects for a Russia-Ukraine peace deal appeared to strengthen, raising expectations of a potential easing of sanctions.】

item.title: 在汽车行业的压力下，欧盟将放宽内燃机禁令
item.description: 在德国、意大利和欧洲汽车行业的强大压力下，欧盟委员会将在欧盟 2035 年禁止新内燃机汽车的禁令上走回头路，允许最多 10%的非电动汽车。【原文：The European Commission is set to backtrack on the EU's ban on new combustion-engine cars from 2035 by allowing up to 10% of non-electric vehicles after intense pressure from Germany, Italy and Europe's auto sector.】

item.title: 交易员关注推迟发布的美国就业数据，美元处于守势
item.description: 周二亚洲交易时段开始时，美元汇率一度跌至两个月低点附近，因为市场正在等待一系列经济数据的公布，其中包括推迟公布的11月份美国就业报告。【原文：The U.S. dollar sagged to near a two-month low at the start of the Asian trading session on Tuesday as markets awaited the release of a slew of economic data, including the delayed November U.S. jobs report.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称美国暂停与英国的技术交易
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，美国已暂停执行与英国达成的一项技术协议。【原文：The United States has suspended implementation of a technology deal it struck with the UK, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】
